greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of smallest and greatest prime factors of n.
comment: For all n > 1, a(n) is semiprime; n is semiprime iff a(n) = n; n is prime iff a(n) = n^2;
For all primes p and k > 0, a(p^k) = p^2.
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) { for (n = 1, 10000, if (n==1, a=1, f=factor(n)~; a=f[1, 1] * f[1, length(f)]); write("b066048.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Nov 08 2009
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 03 2002
